description.en: The course starts with an introduction to R - one of the most powerful data analysis and visualisation language, that has been taking over both business world and academia. R is open source software, but is frequently mentioned to have a rather steep learning curve. We will overcome this together. We will go through the modern R workflow starting from data aquisition and munging and ending with publication ready visualisation of our data.
description.et: Kursus algab põhjalikuma R-i tutvustamisega. Tegu on ühe võimekaima andmeanalüüsi- ja -graafikakeskkonnaga, mis on tänapäeval üle võtmas nii äri- kui teadusmaailma. R on vabavara, kuid tema puhul on välja toodud suhteliselt järsku õppimiskõverat, kursuse eesmärk on sellest üheskoos üle saada. Jätkame moodsa R-i töövoo omandamisega alates andmete sisselugemisest, grupeerimisest, filtreerimisest kuni publikatsioonikõlbulike visualisatsioonide loomiseni.

objectives.en: The aim of the subject is to give participants practical ability for the whole process of data analysis starting from data wrangling and initial visual analysis to publication-ready data visualisations in R.
objectives.et: Eesmärk on luua praktilised oskused kogu andmeanalüüsi protsessi läbimiseks alates andmetöötlusest ja esmasest visuaalsest analüüsist kuni "publitseerimis-kvaliteediga" andme-graafikani andmeanalüüsikeskkonnas R, rõhuga visualiseerimisel.

learning_outcomes.en: Practical working knowledge of R and RStudio.
learning_outcomes.et: Esmane võimekus hakkamasaamiseks andmeanalüüsikeskkonnas R ja Rstudios.

learning_outcomes.en: Ability to do the basic data mungling in R - to filter and group data, convert it between long and short format.
learning_outcomes.et: Oskus andmeid esmaselt töödelda - filtreerida, grupeerida, pikalt laiale ja laialt pikale kujule viia.

learning_outcomes.en: Good conceptual knowledge of the concepts of grammar of graphics.
learning_outcomes.et: Hea arusaam graafika grammatika (grammar of graphics) kontseptsioonist.

learning_outcomes.en: Ability to use ggplot2 (R package implementing grammar of graphics) for visual data analysis and presentation of results.
learning_outcomes.et: Oskus kasutada ggplot2'e - graafika grammatika realisatsiooni R-is - nii andmete visuaalseks analüüsiks kui tulemuste edasiandmiseks.

learning_outcomes.en: Ability to use Rmarkdown for reproducible analysis and automatic generation of reports.
learning_outcomes.et: Oskus kasutada Rmarkdowni võimalusi raportite automatiseerimiseks.

grade_preconditions.et: You will have to have positive evaluations for all the homeworks.

grade_evaluation.et: Homeworks 25%, classroom part of the exam 45%, take-home part of the exam 30%. All of them need to get at least 51% from grading.

description.et:
NB! The exact order of the topics might and will change depending on the progress we will be making. The final version of handouts will be uploaded before the session. The currently available versions might change.

Please have the latest version of R (https://cloud.r-project.org/) and Rstudio (https://www.rstudio.com/products/rstudio/download/preview/) installed.

Introduction to the course. The basics of R and RStudio. Dealing witth objects in R, data types, data frames, help system, getting data in and out.
Getting data in from online databases. Logical operators in R. Intro to grammar of graphics (ggplot2). Prepare to be amazed. We will be using the concepts throughout the course.
Dealing with factors. Tidy data and converting between long and wide format of data. Tedious, boring stuff, but needs to be done. Intro to grammar of grammatics.

Continuing with grammar of graphics. Intro to rmarkdown - how to write entire reports in R. Try to hava a LaTeX distribution installed. This would be MikTex for windows users (https://miktex.org/download) and MacTex for Mac users (http://www.tug.org/mactex/). Note that the installs are enormous.
Lists, writing functions in R, joining datasets.
There will probably be a lecture about git somewhere around here
Overview of a dataset, tabulating data etc. Briefly about working with and visualizing financial timeseries in R (tidyquant).

A gentle intro to uncertainty in data analysis. How to interpret point esitmates and confidence intervals, what is a normal distribution. 
A lecture on data visualisation by Janno Järve
The basics of modelling data in R.
in reserve -- we have an additional week in the timetable as I am probably going to miss one week.
The classroom part of the exam (be there at time).
